ibis.cashmere.constellation

Class Cashmere

  • java.lang.Object
    • ibis.cashmere.constellation.Cashmere

  • public class Cashmere
extends java.lang.Object
    The entry point to the Cashmere library.

    The Cashmere class is the main entry point for the library. Cashmere's responsibility is to schedule MCL kernels within one node. A typical setup for a Cashmere program is initialize Cashmere and request whether this instance isMaster(). Non-master instances of Cashmere typically execute done immediately, while the master will launch Activity instances of Constellation with submit(Activity). These activities should be set up such that they can be stolen by other nodes in the cluster.

    Activities may want to launch MCL kernels to the many-core device if there is one available. The MCL compiler will generate an MCL.java file from that will have to be included in the source directory of the Cashmere application. The Cashmere will system will compile those kernels automatically and they will be available with the getKernel() methods. To launch a kernel, we can create a KernelLaunch with Kernel.createLaunch(). The kernel can then be launched with launch.

        public static void initialize(ConstellationConfiguration[] config)
                       throws ConstellationCreationException

        Parameters:
        config - the configuration for Constellation
        Throws:
        ConstellationCreationException - if a Constellation instance could not be created.

                       throws ConstellationCreationException
        Initializes the Cashmere library.
        Parameters:
        config - the configuration for Constellation
        props - the Properties for Cashmere
        kernelDefines - the define statements for the MCL kernels
        nrBuffers - the number of Buffer instances to allocate
        sizeBuffer - the size of the Buffer instances
        Throws:
        ConstellationCreationException - if a Constellation instance could not be created.

      • setupLibrary

        public static void setupLibrary(java.lang.String name,
                                InitLibraryFunction initLibraryFunc,
                                DeInitLibraryFunction deInitLibraryFunc)
        Setup an OpenCL library. The initLibraryFunc and deInitLibraryFunc functions need to implement functionality to set up the library with Cashmere's OpenCL data structures such as cl_context. To actually register/unregister the library with Cashmere, it necessary to call initializeLibraries() and deinitializeLibraries() respectively.
        Parameters:
        name - a user-defined name for the OpenCL library
        initLibraryFunc - a function that initializes the OpenCL library
        deInitLibraryFunc - a function that deinitializes the OpenCL library

      • initializeLibraries

        public static void initializeLibraries()
        Initialize the libraries that have been set up. The libraries should have been set up with setupLibrary(java.lang.String, ibis.cashmere.constellation.InitLibraryFunction, ibis.cashmere.constellation.DeInitLibraryFunction).

      • deinitializeLibraries

        public static void deinitializeLibraries()
        Deinitialize the libraries that have been set up. The libraries should have been set up with setupLibrary(java.lang.String, ibis.cashmere.constellation.InitLibraryFunction, ibis.cashmere.constellation.DeInitLibraryFunction).

      • isMaster

        public static boolean isMaster()
        Requests whether this node is the Constellation master.
        Returns:
        true if this node is the Constellation master.

                                 throws NoSuitableExecutorException
        Submit an Activity.
        Parameters:
        a - the Activity to submit.
        Returns:
        an ActivityIdentifier that identifies the Activity
        Throws:
        NoSuitableExecutorException - if an error occurs

      • getKernel

        public static Kernel getKernel()
                        throws CashmereNotAvailable
        Retrieve the registered MCL kernel. This method only works if there is only one MCL kernel registered.
        Returns:
        the registered Kernel
        Throws:
        CashmereNotAvailable - if Cashmere could not initialize because it could not find suitable many-core devices.

      • getKernel

        public static Kernel getKernel(java.lang.String name)
                        throws CashmereNotAvailable
        Retrieve the MCL kernel with name name. The fastest available Device is selected.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the kernel
        Returns:
        the Kernel with name name
        Throws:
        CashmereNotAvailable - if Cashmere could not initialize because it could not find suitable many-core devices.

      • getKernel

        public static Kernel getKernel(java.lang.String name,
                               Device device)
                        throws CashmereNotAvailable
        Retrieve the MCL kernel with name name for a specific Device.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the kernel
        device - the Device on which the kernel should be registered
        Returns:
        the Kernel with name name
        Throws:
        CashmereNotAvailable - if Cashmere could not initialize because it could not find suitable many-core devices.

      • getLibFunc

        public static LibFunc getLibFunc(java.lang.String libraryName)
                          throws CashmereNotAvailable,
                                 LibFuncNotAvailable
        Retrieve the OpenCL library function with library name libraryName.
        Parameters:
        libraryName - the name of the library
        Returns:
        the LibFunc associated with library libraryName
        Throws:
        CashmereNotAvailable - if Cashmere could not initialize because it could not find suitable many-core devices.
        LibFuncNotAvailable - if the library function has not been set up or initialized
        See Also:
        setupLibrary(java.lang.String, ibis.cashmere.constellation.InitLibraryFunction, ibis.cashmere.constellation.DeInitLibraryFunction), initializeLibraries()

      • getLibFunc

        Parameters:
